title: Rising demand and falling costs clear path for satellite servicing
summary:
MOUNTAIN VIEW, California – Satellite-servicing businesses are finally getting off the ground thanks in part to technological innovation and the example set by prime contractor Northrop Grumman. “There is no shame in saying that we are riding on Northrop’s coattails,” said Luis Vidal, Starfish Space commercial geostationary business development director. “Northrop broke the suspension of […]

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch 29 Starlink satellites on Falcon 9 rocket from Cape Canaveral
summary: This is just the second time that SpaceX opted to launch 29 of its Starlink V2 Mini satellites in one batch, the current limit for the Falcon 9 rocket. Liftoff of the Starlink 10-37 mission from pad 40 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station is scheduled for 12:16 p.m. EDT (1616 UTC).

title: Blue Origin details lunar exploration progress amid Artemis 3 contract shakeup
summary: The company’s senior director of civil space shared the progress on their crew and cargo Blue Moon landers during the American Astronautical Society’s 2025 von Braun Space Exploration Symposium.

title: Shutdown could soon slow preparations for Artemis 2
summary:
Preparations for NASA’s Artemis 2 launch could soon grind to a halt if the nearly month-long government shutdown continues, one industry executive warned.

title: FCC proposes ‘licensing assembly line’ to accelerate satellite approvals
summary:
The FCC voted Oct. 28 to propose creating a modular “licensing assembly line” that would overhaul its satellite application process to accelerate reviews and cut red tape.

title: Melissa strikes Jamaica, tied as most powerful Atlantic storm to come ashore
summary: The storm was so strong a hurricane hunter had to end its mission early.

title: Slingshot sells first sensors in UK deal as more nations seek space-tracking sovereignty
summary:
Slingshot Aerospace is in talks with other countries to create or expand space-tracking capabilities after selling optical sensors to the U.K., marking the California-based company’s first deal for the hardware behind its monitoring software.
